target.name: show.was9.setup.targets
target.echo:
Following targets are for WAS9 setup:
- build_WAS9_ND: build entire WAS9 environment, including create IIS website - rebuild_WAS9_ND: rebuild entire WAS9 environment - was9.create.dmgr.profile: creates dmgr profile [${dmgr.profile.name}] - was9.delete.dmgr.profile: deletes dmgr profile [${dmgr.profile.name}] - was9.create.node.profile: creates node profile [${node1.profile.name}] - was9.start.node.service: start Node Windows services - was9.delete.node.profile: delete node profile [${node1.profile.name}] - was9.create.presit.profile: creates dmgr and node profile - was9.delete.all.profile: delete dmgr and node profile - was9.display.dmgr.info: displays information about the dmgr profile [${dmgr.profile.name}] - was9.display.profile.info: displays information about the node profile [${node1.profile.name}] - was9.stop.all.services: stop dmgr and node Windows services - was9.start.all.services: start dmgr and node Windows services
- was9.setup.all: calls following was9 targets: - was9.configure.env.vars: configure WAS9 Environment variables - was9.setup.security: setup Authetication in WAS - was9.setup.jdbc.providers: setup JDBC providers (XA and non-XA) - was9.setup.datasources: setup all the required Datasources - was9.setup.create.serverName create all apps server name - was9.setup.jvm.classpath: setup JVM classpath - was9.setup.jvm.property: setup process definition custom property - was9.setup.jvm.debug: sets JVM debugMode to true set was.setup.jvm.debug.mode property to false to set debugMode to false - was9.setup.jvm.log: setup JVM log name - was9.setup.virtualhost setup all vitual hosts - was9.setup.jndi.naming: set JNDI naming - copy_p12: copy the customized trust.p12 to dmgr - was9.setup.JMSBindings: generate and copy the JMSBindings for EZK and PSW - was9.setup.iis: create all IIS websites
Maintenance scripts - was9.change.cics: change all JVM custom properties to new cics, regenerate JMSBindings and put in apps folder, need to add change STP datachecker and fileprocessor properties can run as ant -f build_was9ND.xml -DCICS.name=LPDCICS was9.change.cics - was9.delete.iis: delete all IIS sites
